pokemon_bank_region_changed.title: Pokémon Bank Authentication/Connection Error
pokemon_bank_region_changed.description: This error occurs when opening Pokémon Bank on a region changed console, which typically requires a SOAP transfer to resolve.
steps: This error usually indicates your console needs a SOAP transfer.
Please request a SOAP transfer via #request-soap to resolve this issue. If you are already in a SOAP channel, please ask a Soaper for help.

internet_after_soap.title: Internet / Network Error After SOAP
internet_after_soap.description: This error occurs after a SOAP transfer when your Nintendo 3DS has trouble connecting to Nintendo Network or downloading from the eShop.
steps: Power cycle your router and modem, then try again.
Check your internet connection for congestion or bandwidth issues. If other devices are using a lot of bandwidth, your connection may time out.
Check for wireless interference and try moving closer to your router.
Enter alternate DNS settings (such as Google DNS: 8.8.8.8 and 8.8.4.4) into your 3DS Internet settings. [Guide](<https://en-americas-support.nintendo.com/app/answers/detail/a_id/217>)
If the issue persists, this may indicate a temporary service issue on Nintendo's end. Try again tomorrow.

pretendo_enabled.title: Network Error - Pretendo Enabled
pretendo_enabled.description: This error occurs when Pretendo is enabled and you're trying to access Nintendo services.
steps: Pretendo is currently enabled on your console.
Open the **Nimbus** app on your 3DS.
Select **Nintendo Network**.
Try opening the eShop or Pokémon Bank again.
If you're not using Pretendo, this may be a network issue. Please ask a Soaper for help.

eshop_region_changed.title: eShop Region-Changed Console Error
eshop_region_changed.description: This error occurs when opening the eShop on a region changed console, which typically requires a SOAP transfer to resolve.
steps: This error indicates your console needs a SOAP transfer.
Please request a SOAP transfer via #request-soap to resolve this issue. If you are already in a SOAP channel, please ask a Soaper for help.

network_connection_error.title: Network Connection Error
network_connection_error.description: This error can occur due to server maintenance, poor internet connection, or Pretendo being enabled.
steps: If you're using Pretendo, switch to Nintendo Network using the Nimbus app.
Check your internet connection and try power cycling your router and modem.
Enter alternate DNS settings (such as Google DNS: 8.8.8.8 and 8.8.4.4) into your 3DS Internet settings. [Guide](<https://en-americas-support.nintendo.com/app/answers/detail/a_id/217>)
If the issue persists, the server is most likely offline. Please wait for tomorrow and try again.

009-1003.title: Pokémon Bank Authentication Error
009-1003.description: This error occurs when opening Pokémon Bank. You have an old Nintendo Network ID from the wrong region on your system.
steps: To resolve, you must perform a SOAP transfer (via #request-soap). If you've already done this, skip to step 2.
After the SOAP transfer, you will need to remove your old Nintendo Network ID from your system.
**1.** [Make a new NAND backup](<https://3ds.hacks.guide/godmode9-usage.html#creating-a-nand-backup>) and save it somewhere safe.
**2.** Use GodMode9 to [remove your NNID](<https://3ds.hacks.guide/godmode9-usage.html#removing-an-nnid-without-formatting-your-console>) without having to format your console.
After removing the NNID, try opening Pokémon Bank again.

022-2502.title: Out of Region NNID
022-2502.description: This error occurs when opening the eShop on a SOAP'd console with an out-of-region Nintendo Network ID. You must remove your old Nintendo Network ID from your system.
steps: To resolve, you must remove your old Nintendo Network ID from your system.
**1.** [Make a new NAND backup](<https://3ds.hacks.guide/godmode9-usage.html#creating-a-nand-backup>) and save it somewhere safe.
**2.** Use GodMode9 to [remove your NNID](<https://3ds.hacks.guide/godmode9-usage.html#removing-an-nnid-without-formatting-your-console>) without having to format your console.
**3.** Create a new Nintendo Network ID on your console in System Settings.
After creating the new NNID, try opening Pokémon Bank again.

022-2571.title: Pretendo Network ID Handle Already In Use
022-2571.description: This error occurs when the Pretendo Network ID you are trying to create is already taken, or it matches your existing Nintendo Network ID.
steps: If the handle is already taken, simply choose a different Pretendo Network ID handle and try again.
If the handle matches your NNID, **do not delete your NNID**. Just choose a different Pretendo Network ID handle and you are done.
If you attempted to create the Pretendo Network ID from Pretendo's website, create a new Pretendo Network ID there with a different handle and try signing in again on your console.

022-1021.title: NNID Required in New Region
022-1021.description: This error occurs when trying to access Pokémon Bank after a region change without having created a Nintendo Network ID (NNID) in the new region.
steps: On your 3DS, open **System Settings**.
Go to **Nintendo Network ID Settings**.
Create a **new NNID** that matches your new region (do not try to reuse an NNID from the old region).
After creating the new NNID, try opening **Pokémon Bank** again.

014-0016.title: Target Console Issue During System Transfer
014-0016.description: This error typically occurs on the **target console** during a system transfer when there is an issue with the target's existing data or configuration.
steps: On the *target console*, make sure all important save data is backed up using **Checkpoint**.
Confirm that any other important data on the target console is safely backed up.
After verifying your backups, perform a **System Format** on the *target console* from System Settings.
Once the format is complete, try the system transfer again.
